p: Although meat alternatives and other plant-based products (e.g., beverages) are presented as less environmentally harmful, the sustainability gains from these products are still a subject of debate and study. The evidence is clear on the lower environmental footprint of legume production [ 5, 6] but the influence of legumes in reducing greenhouse gas emissions also depends on the management of the agro-ecosystem used (e.g., mono cropping vs. conservation agriculture) [ 65]. In addition, the post-harvest processing factor may play a role in sustainability.
